citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
At the time of inspection, the protocols did not have written assurance that the activities do not unnecessarily duplicate
previous experiments. Unnecessary duplication of research protocols may subject animals to repeated or prolonged
procedures without scientific justification, increased risk of pain, stress, and have a negative impact on the animal
psychologically. Within the protocols, the principle investigator must provide written assurance that the activities do not
unnecessarily duplicate previous experiments.
CORRECTION DATE: 29 JANUARY 2026

This facility's annual contingency plan review has not been documented for the year. The annual review and
documentation of the review, ensures that contingency planning incorporates facility changes and new resources for the
management of emergency situations for the animals. Each registrant must maintain documentation of their annual
reviews, including documenting any amendments or changes made since the previous year's review.
CORRECTION DATE: 21 JANUARY 2026
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.31(d)(1)(iii) 
   
Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC). 
At the time of inspection, the protocols did not have written assurance that the activities do not unnecessarily duplicate 
previous experiments. Unnecessary duplication of research protocols may subject animals to repeated or prolonged 
procedures without scientific justification, increased risk of pain, stress, and have a negative impact on the animal 
psychologically. Within the protocols, the principle investigator must provide written assurance that the activities do not 
unnecessarily duplicate previous experiments. 
 
CORRECTION DATE: 29 JANUARY 2026 
2.38(l)(2) 
   
Miscellaneous. 
This facility's annual contingency plan review has not been documented for the year. The annual review and 
documentation of the review, ensures that contingency planning incorporates facility changes and new resources for the 
management of emergency situations for the animals. Each registrant must maintain documentation of their annual 
reviews, including documenting any amendments or changes made since the previous year's review. 
 
CORRECTION DATE: 21 JANUARY 2026 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative.
